revised_title: Epidemiology and Ecology of Gastrointestinal Nematode Parasites in Ruminant Grazing Systems
tldr: This article explores the impact of gastrointestinal nematode parasites on the productivity and stability of intensive ruminant grazing systems. It presents a mathematical model that accounts for the effects of parasitism on ruminant feeding rate and productivity, and compares the results with field observations. The study highlights the importance of understanding the population biology of plant-herbivore and host-parasite interactions to improve grazing system management and reduce production losses due to parasitic gastroenteritis.
